events.title: Trump’s shadow war in Venezuela grows, but country’s strongman leader still clings to power
events.description: Report of a drone attack on a port facility signals new phase in US military campaign against Nicolás Maduro US wargames played out scenarios for Maduro’s fall. None of them ended well for Venezuela Nearly a week after Donald Trump first announced what he said was the first US ground strike in a four-month-long military pressure campaign against Venezuela , details remain very thin on the ground. CNN and the New York Times reported late on Monday that they had confirmed the CIA had used a drone to target a “port facility” allegedly used by the Tren de Aragua street gang. No casualties were reported, but the date, time and location of the attack remain unknown. Venezuela’s strongman leader, Nicolás Maduro , and his government have remained silent. If confirmed, the first strike on land would mark a new phase in a campaign that since August has involved the deployment of a massive US naval fleet, airstrikes that have so far killed 107 people, a “total blockade” of sanctioned oil tankers, the seizure of two vessels and the pursuit of a third. Continue reading...

events.title: US military destroys narco-terror convoy of three vessels at sea in kinetic strikes
events.description: U.S. military strikes reportedly kill three people in overnight operation against alleged narco-terrorist drug trafficking convoy in international waters.

events.title: Anthony Joshua’s camp confirm two of his close friends died in Nigeria car crash
events.description: British former boxing champion sustained minor injuries Sina Ghami and Kevin ‘Lateef’ Ayodel killed in accident The British heavyweight boxer Anthony Joshua has issued a statement after he was injured in a car crash in Nigeria on Monday morning which killed two of his close friends. The former world heavyweight boxing champion was taken to an undisclosed hospital after his car hit a stationary vehicle at about 11am on the Lagos-Ibadan Expressway, the Ogun state police commissioner, Lanre Ogunlowo, said. The driver of Joshua’s vehicle was also injured, he added. Continue reading...

events.title: Sydney New Year’s Eve strikes sombre tone as fireworks follow minute’s silence for Bondi
events.description: Terror attack victims remembered with menorah projected on to Harbour Bridge before dazzling display Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Australia paused to show solidarity with the Jewish community as New Year’s Eve festivities rolled across the nation. Weeks on from the Bondi Beach terrorist attack , hundreds of thousands of people around Sydney Harbour observed a minute’s silence and shone a collective, defiant light after the recent atrocity. Continue reading...

events.title: UN, US sign $2 billion humanitarian funding agreement for 17 crisis-hit countries
events.description: The United Nations and the United States on Monday formalized an agreement under which the US committed $2 billion in humanitarian assistance for global relief programmes, a move the UN’s top relief official hailed as a landmark commitment to saving lives amid escalating humanitarian needs worldwide.

events.title: Hamas confirms five leaders killed, including 'masked spokesperson' in major blow to terror group
events.description: Five Hamas military commanders confirmed dead by terrorist group's armed wing, marking significant blow to Palestinian militant organization's leadership structure in Gaza conflict.

events.title: Sudan civil war: Health system ‘on the verge of collapse’
events.description: The war in Sudan has been tearing the country apart for almost 1,000 days, putting the country’s health system under intolerable pressure. The World Health Organization (WHO) is reporting widespread disease outbreaks, severe shortages, malnutrition and rising deaths.

events.title: Syria: Guterres deplores deadly mosque blast in Homs
events.description: UN Secretary-General António Guterres “unequivocally condemns” the deadly terrorist attack on a mosque in Homs, Syria during Friday prayers, his spokesperson said in a statement

events.title: Australian police find no evidence of 'broader terrorist cell' in Bondi Beach antisemitic shooting
events.description: Police say an investigation that extended to the Philippines of two men accused of killing 15 people at a Sydney Jewish festival has found no evidence they were part of a “broader terrorist cell.”

events.title: Dispatch records from Brown University shooting capture chaos of deadly campus attack
events.description: Newly obtained police records reveal chaotic emergency response to Brown University shooting that left two students dead and multiple wounded on Dec. 13.

events.title: At least 13 people killed and 98 injured in train derailment in Mexico
events.description: Train accident in Oaxaca is likely to raise criticisms about public works projects from the previous administration At least 13 people were killed when a train derailed in the Mexican state of Oaxaca, in an accident which is likely to revive opposition criticisms of the speed and dealings with which the country’s government builds its flagship public works projects. The incident took place on the Interoceanic Train, which was built to link the Atlantic and Pacific oceans across the narrowest part of the Isthmus of Tehuantepec, creating an alternative rail cargo route to the Panama canal intended to drive development in the region. Continue reading...

events.title: UN chief urges world leaders to ‘get priorities straight’ as New Year message calls for peace over war
events.description: As the world enters 2026 amid mounting crises, the UN Secretary-General António Guterres has issued a stark but hopeful New Year appeal, urging global leaders to shift resources away from destruction and towards development, peace and people.

events.title: Sri Lanka cyclone: More than a million still need aid weeks after Ditwah floods
events.description: Nearly a month after Cyclone Ditwah tore across Sri Lanka, more than a million people – including over half a million children – remain in urgent need of humanitarian assistance, as floods, landslides and renewed rainfall continue to compound one of the country’s worst disasters in decades.

events.title: US military says three killed in strikes on alleged drug boats
events.description: The US military said on Wednesday that it had carried out strikes on three alleged drug-smuggling boats in international waters, killing three people. The latest operation is part of a wider campaign that has drawn criticism from legal experts and rights groups.

events.title: Iran's pres. says answer to attack would be harsh in response to Trump warning
events.description: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian says his country’s answer to an attack would be harsh

events.title: Afghanistan to remain major crisis in 2026, UN, partners warn
events.description: Afghanistan is expected to remain one of the world’s largest humanitarian crises in 2026, UN agencies and humanitarian partners warned on Tuesday, launching a $1.7 billion appeal to assist nearly 18 million people in urgent need.

events.title: Greetings from Vienna, where an imperial palace hosts a holiday market for all
events.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

events.title: Germany news: Police face risk of violence on New Year's Eve
events.description: The German Police Trade Union warned of possible violence against emergency services during New Year's Eve celebrations. DW has more.

events.title: UN peacekeeper injured in gunfire near ‘Blue Line’ in south Lebanon
events.description: One United Nations peacekeeper was injured on Friday after heavy machine gunfire from Israel Defense Forces (IDF) positions south of the Blue Line, following a nearby grenade explosion, impacted close to a UN patrol in southern Lebanon.

events.title: Israel to bar 37 aid groups as UK and EU warn of severe impact in Gaza
events.description: Israel's move is criticised by 10 countries, which say the new registration rules for international NGOs are "restrictive" and "unacceptable".

events.title: Palestinians in Gaza say ‘lives will be destroyed’ by Israel’s NGO ban
events.description: Displaced people in Gaza warn new restrictions on aid group will 'lead to catastrophe' in devastated enclave.

events.title: Suicide bomber kills at least one police officer in Syria’s Aleppo
events.description: Officials say a 'terrorist' detonated suicide belt as police protecting New Year's Eve festivities tried to detain him.

events.title: Woman dies after being swept into ocean from Sydney beach in early hours of New Year’s Day
events.description: Police said 25-year-old woman hit by a wave near a tidal rock pool at Maroubra, and another swimmer missing at Coogee Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast A woman has been found dead after being swept out into the ocean from a Sydney beach in the early hours of New Year’s Day, as authorities issue a warning about dangerous surf conditions on the NSW coast. Later in the morning another swimmer went missing in the water at Coogee. Continue reading...

events.title: SECURITY COUNCIL LIVE: Briefing on threats to international peace and security
events.description: The UN Security Council meets today to hear a briefing on threats to international peace and security following Israel’s recent recognition of the northern region of Somalia as an independent and sovereign state. Follow live below and UN News app users can click here and go here for all our in-depth meeting coverage.

events.title: 'Shivering from cold and fear': Winter rains flood Gaza camps
events.description: Winter rain lashed the Gaza Strip over the weekend, flooding camps with ankle-deep puddles as Palestinians displaced by two years of war attempted to stay dry in tents frayed by months of use. The foreign ministers of 10 nations on Tuesday expressed "serious concerns" about a "renewed deterioration of the humanitarian situation" in Gaza, saying the situation was "catastrophic". Story by Solange Mougin.

events.title: How climate change is threatening human rights
events.description: With rising effects of climate change across the globe, the world has started recognising that climate change is not just an ecological collapse, but also a human rights crisis.

events.title: Iranian protesters clash with security forces as tear gas fills Tehran streets amid nationwide unrest
events.description: Iran protests escalated as demonstrators clashed with security forces in Tehran and Mashhad, with tear gas deployed amid nationwide strikes, reports say.

events.title: Trump vows to 'knock the hell out of' Iran if nuclear program is rebuilt again after high-stakes meeting
events.description: Trump warns Iran he'll 'knock the hell out of them' if nuclear program rebuilds, as new reports allegedly detail chemical weapons development for missiles.

events.title: Protesters take to the streets of Iran as the country's economy collapses
events.description: Protests over the economy are sweeping through Iran. The country's currency is plummeting amid concerns Israel will restart its war with Iran, a move President Trump signaled he would approve.

events.title: Protests spread across Iran, as the country faces unrest over economic struggles
events.description: Iranian students staged street protests in Tehran on Tuesday, a day after the capital's shopkeepers demonstrated against economic hardship and won a message of understanding from the president. Story by Emily Boyle.

events.title: Anthony Joshua discharged from hospital after fatal road crash
events.description: Anthony Joshua has been discharged from hospital days after a car crash in Nigeria that killed two of his close friends.

events.title: UN renews ceasefire push in Sudan
events.description: The UN has urged Sudan’s warring parties to pursue compromise and an immediate ceasefire, even as drone attacks, displacement and the killing of peacekeepers underscore the growing risks to civilians and humanitarians.

events.title: Anti-Iran regime protests grow across country as Trump admin boosts demonstrators offering support
events.description: U.S. officials voice support for Iranian demonstrators as protests intensify following currency crisis, with reports of tear gas and security crackdowns.

events.title: Russia's nuclear-capable Oreshnik missiles have entered active service, Moscow says
events.description: Russia’s nuclear-capable Oreshnik missile system has entered active service, Russia’s Ministry of Defense says, as negotiators continue to search for a breakthrough in peace talks to end Moscow’s war in Ukraine

events.title: Missing elderly person found in bitter cold woods after police deploy thermal imaging drone
events.description: Philadelphia police rescued a missing elderly person from a wooded area Sunday using thermal imaging drone technology in coordinated search effort.

events.title: Netanyahu warns of ‘eighth front’ ideological battle for American hearts and minds with Christian leaders
events.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu warns of 'eighth front' in ideological battle, telling Christian leaders that faith must confront terrorism in defense of civilization.

events.title: ‘Only Trump can stop Russia’: Millions face freezing winter, Ukraine energy executive warns
events.description: Ukraine's largest private energy company reports 90% of generation capacity damaged by Russian attacks, leaving over 1 million without power during freezing temperatures.

events.title: Trump says US hit 'big facility' linked to alleged Venezuelan drug boats
events.description: The US president would not confirm US media reports that the explosion was caused by a CIA drone strike.

events.title: Australia says ‘deeply concerning, destabilising’ Chinese exercises near Taiwan risk inflaming regional tension
events.description: Foreign affairs department statement says Australia opposes any actions that ‘increase the risk of accident, miscalculation or escalation’ Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Australia says it is deeply concerned about Chinese military exercises near Taiwan, and has raised the issue with Chinese officials. In a statement released on Wednesday , the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (Dfat) said the large-scale simulations risked destabilising the region and could result in an accident or escalation. Continue reading...

events.title: Iran on the brink? Key information about the protests
events.description: Iran has been gripped by demonstrations amid the country's economic crisis, with social discontent fueling open protest against the regime. Media and authorities have pinned the blame on foreign intelligence services.

events.title: Ukraine: Attacks disrupt heating as temperatures plunge
events.description: Recent attacks across Ukraine have killed civilians, damaged critical infrastructure and cut heating and power supplies for millions, UN humanitarians report, as temperatures drop below freezing.

events.title: These are the countries attacked by Israel in 2025
events.description: In 2025, Israel carried out thousands of attacks in Gaza, with at least 10,600 attacks record across multiple countries

events.title: Iran's economic crisis, political discontent threaten regime
events.description: Protests triggered by soaring inflation and a collapsing currency have highlighted widespread political discontent. Analysts say the deep economic woes are a major challenge to the regime's authority.

events.title: New Year's Eve live: World ushers in 2026
events.description: DW has all the updates as the world celebrates the end of 2025 and looks forward to 2026.

events.title: Taiwan remains on alert as China ends military drills
events.description: China had fired rockets and deployed dozens of aircraft and naval vessels in exercises simulating a blockade of Taiwan's ports. Taipei condemned the drills as a threat to regional security.

events.title: Tensions between Saudis and Emiratis over future of Yemen reach boiling point
events.description: Dispute has potential to create civil war in south of Yemen and spill over into neighbouring countries Tensions between the United Arab Emirates and Saudi Arabia over the future of Yemen and the imminent possibility of the declaration of an independent southern state have reached boiling point with Saudi Arabia in effect accusing the UAE of threatening its future security. The dispute has the potential to create a civil war within the south of Yemen and also spill over into other disputes including in Sudan and the Horn of Africa where the two countries often find themselves backing opposite sides. Yemen could yet become only one theatre in which the two vastly wealthy Gulf states vie for political influence, control of shipping lanes and commercial access. Continue reading...

events.title: ‘Tonga is not a threat’: anger as small Pacific nation falls under Trump visa restrictions
events.description: Community leaders raise alarm over study links and Polynesian ties, with Tonga to face restrictions from January as US says too many overstay The small Pacific nation of Tonga is one of more than a dozen countries to be hit with visa and entry restrictions on 1 January as the Trump administration tightens its crackdown on immigration. In December , the US said it would further restrict and limit the entry of foreign nationals to protect the country from “national security and public safety threats”. Continue reading...

events.title: Iranian protesters attempt to break in to government building as demonstrations escalate
events.description: Iranian protesters attempted to storm a local government building on Wednesday, state media reported, as demonstrations over the cost of living reached their fourth day.

events.title: Indonesia raises alert for the Mount Bur Ni Telong volcano
events.description: Authorities in Indonesia have raised the alert level for the Mount Bur Ni Telong volcano to its second highest following a series of increased activity and volcanic earthquakes

events.title: Sexual violence against children ‘entrenched, systemic and widespread’ across DR Congo, UNICEF warns
events.description: Sexual violence against children has become entrenched, systemic and increasingly widespread across the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), with new data showing a sharp rise in cases since 2022, according to the UN Children’s Fund (UNICEF).

events.title: Putin residence attack video slammed; US officials say Ukraine did not target leader
events.description: Defense experts questioned Russia's drone attack claims against President Vladimir Putin's residence after Moscow provides conflicting accounts of intercepted Ukrainian drones.

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: Central African Republic goes to polls as president seeks third term
events.description: Opposition hopes to tap into frustrations of people living in country where conflict remains a daily reality Central African Republic goes to the polls on Sunday with the president, Faustin-Archange Touadéra, seeking a third term. As many as 2.3 million registered voters will cast ballots for what observers are calling a quadruple election: votes for the presidency and parliament as well as local and municipal offices. Continue reading...

events.title: Venezuela says it released 99 people detained for 2024 election protests
events.description: Government said the move was due to its ‘unrestricted respect for human rights’ in the face of US aggression Venezuela has said it has carried out its largest release of political prisoners this year, claiming to have freed 99 people detained for taking part in protests after the 2024 election, widely believed to have been stolen by the dictator Nicolás Maduro , as it comes under increasing military pressure from the US. Civil society organisations have treated the news with caution and stressed that the releases were insufficient, noting that at least 900 political prisoners remain in the country. Continue reading...

events.title: Israel bans dozens of aid groups from Gaza, despite immense needs
events.description: Dozens of international aid groups, like Doctors Without Borders, are now banned from entering Gaza under new rules set by Israel.

events.title: Somali daycare in Minnesota broken into, key documents stolen in overnight burglary
events.description: A Somali-run daycare in Minneapolis was allegedly broken into amid ongoing fraud investigations. Important employee and child documents reportedly missing.

events.title: Iran launches satellites on Russian rockets as Moscow-Tehran ties deepen
events.description: Iran launches three satellites with Russian assistance, showcasing deepening cooperation as they resist Western sanctions and international pressure.

events.title: In pictures: New Year welcomed around the world
events.description: From spectacular firework displays to chilly sea dips, nations celebrate the start of 2026.

events.title: New Year’s Eve celebrations as the world welcomes 2026
events.description: As the world enters 2026, cities celebrate with fireworks, concerts and gatherings across different time zones.

events.title: White House ‘looking at’ denaturalising Somali Americans for alleged fraud
events.description: Trump renews attacks on Somali Americans a day after freezing federal childcare funding to Minnesota over fraud claims.

events.title: Photos: The world welcomes the new year
events.description: As fireworks light the sky and crowds count down together, communities around the globe welcome 2026.

events.title: An escalation in Yemen threatens to reignite civil war and widen tensions in the Gulf
events.description: Saudi Arabia bombed Yemen's port city of Mukalla, targeting a shipment of weapons from the United Arab Emirates for separatist forces. The UAE later said it would withdraw its forces from Yemen.

events.title: In pictures: World ushers in 2026 with fireworks and light shows
events.description: Australia, New Zealand and several eastern Asian nations were the first countries to ring in 2026 with spectacular fireworks displays. The rest of Asia, Africa and Europe will be the next regions to watch as the countdown clock ticks down to midnight.

events.title: Kohberger plea, Cincinnati beating, Read verdict fuel 2025’s most viral, controversial moments
events.description: Viral video of Cincinnati racial beating sparks national outrage as Charlie Kirk's assassination and Shamsud-Din Jabbar's New Orleans attack dominate 2025 headlines.

events.title: Sydney sends message of peace for New Year's after Bondi attack
events.description: The words peace and unity were projected onto the Sydney Harbour Bridge as thousands gathered to watch the annual fireworks.

events.title: Machu Picchu train crash leaves one dead and dozens injured
events.description: A train driver died and at least 40 people were injured in the crash on the single-track line to Machu Picchu.

events.title: Finland seizes vessel suspected of damaging undersea cable
events.description: European countries are on high alert following a series of suspected sabotage attacks on underwater cables and pipelines.

events.title: Six ways the 2026 World Cup will be different
events.description: The United States is set to host the 2026 World Cup, along with Canada and Mexico. DW fills you in on why this tournament will be different than its predecessors.

events.title: Israel moves to suspend major aid groups in Gaza
events.description: Israel has been tightening oversight of humanitarian groups in Gaza, warning that dozens of organizations face suspension for failing to submit lists of their Palestinian employees.

events.title: Aid to Gaza under threat: Dozens of NGOs to be barred under new Israeli rules
events.description: Dozens of NGOs expect to see their licenses to operate in Gaza revoked on January 1 for failing to comply with Israel’s new rules for the Palestinian territory. Their expulsion comes as Gazans face harsh winter conditions and a deepening humanitarian crisis.

events.title: Thailand releases 18 Cambodian prisoners of war as part of ceasefire agreement
events.description: Thailand has repatriated 18 Cambodian prisoners of war

events.title: Turkey detains 125 more Islamic State suspects as nationwide sweep continues
events.description: Turkish authorities have detained 125 suspected Islamic State members in raids across 25 provinces

events.title: Body found during search for missing Texas teen Camila Mendoza Olmos as another teen girl disappears
events.description: Texas authorities find body and firearm during search for 19-year-old Camila Olmos who vanished Christmas Eve from Bexar County in ongoing case.

events.title: China launches largest military drills off Taiwan in 8 months with live-fire exercises caught on camera
events.description: China launches biggest military encirclement of Taiwan in 8 months with live-fire drills, rockets and warships in massive 'Justice Mission 2025' exercise.

events.title: U.S. announces more military actions against ISIS: 'We will not relent'
events.description: CENTCOM declared that the U.S. and partner forces in Syria killed and captured ISIS figures in the time since a December 19 strike in Syria.

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: France targets Australia-style social media ban for children next year
events.description: Draft bill to be submitted for legal checks as France aims to follow Australia’s world-first ban on platforms including Facebook, Snapchat and YouTube France intends to follow Australia and ban social media platforms for children from the start of the 2026 academic year. A draft bill preventing under-15s from using social media will be submitted for legal checks and is expected to be debated in parliament early in the new year. Continue reading...

events.title: France plans social media ban for children under 15: reports
events.description: After Australia's world-first social-media ban for minors, France has drafted a similar law to block under-15s from major platforms, which could take effect from September.

events.title: Israel bans 37 aid groups from Gaza, where the humanitarian situation remains dire
events.description: Israel plans to ban 37 aid organisations from operating in Gaza from Thursday unless they hand over detailed information on their Palestinian staff, despite mounting criticism from the United Nations and the European Union. Several NGOs have told AFP the new rules will have a major impact on food and medical shipments to Gaza, and humanitarian groups warn there is already not enough aid to cover the devastated territory's needs. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondent in Jerusalem, Noga Tarnopolsky.

events.title: Another child dies in extreme conditions in Gaza: UNICEF
events.description: A sixth child has died in Gaza this month as the enclave’s people continue to endure dire living conditions linked to freezing rains and the Israel-Hamas war, the UN Children’s Fund (UNICEF) has announced. The development comes as aid agencies urged Israeli authorities to reconsider revoking the licences of dozens of humanitarian partners that provide assistance across the devastated enclave from 1 January.

events.title: Unseen Walmart video shows Bryan Kohberger acting differently after Idaho student murders
events.description: New video reveals Bryan Kohberger made 13 Walmart trips during Idaho semester, with suspicious behavior changes after November 2022 student massacre.

events.title: UK PM Starmer–praised Egyptian extremist faces counter-terror probe over resurfaced tweets
events.description: U.K. counterterrorism police assess controversial social media posts by Egyptian-British activist after his return to Britain sparked political backlash.

events.title: Why flu cases are surging this season. And, protests erupt in Iran over the economy
events.description: The flu is spreading rapidly across the U.S. this season, and it is expected to get worse. And, protests have erupted across Iran over the country's troubled economy.

events.title: Iranian university students join protests over soaring cost of living
events.description: University students in Iran have joined shopkeepers and bazaar merchants in protests over the country's soaring cost of living.

events.title: Sudan: UN warns of unprecedented child hunger in Darfur as fighting fuels refugee exodus
events.description: Sudan’s deepening war is driving unprecedented levels of hunger, child malnutrition and displacement, UN agencies report, as new data from Darfur and a renewed refugee influx into Chad underscore the rapidly deteriorating situation.

events.title: Gaza battered by heavy rains as humanitarian response continues
events.description: Severe weather conditions have led to further casualties and heightened health risks in Gaza over the past 24 hours, the UN aid coordination office (OCHA) reported on Monday.

events.title: Girl begged for help months before alleged killing by father, girlfriend — earlier abuse case closed: report
events.description: Newly released police records reveal 10-year-old Rebekah Baptiste pleaded for help months before allegedly being killed by her father and girlfriend.

events.title: Iran protesters try to break into government building as unrest continues
events.description: Video verified by the BBC shows a crowd breaking the gate of the governor's office in Fasa.

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer François Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: Leaps and bounds - how the power of AI expanded further in 2025
events.description: It's only been three years since ChatGPT leaped onto the world stage, but artificial intelligence is now becoming an integral part of daily life. The technology has been integrated into search engines, social media apps and online shopping sites, but also shaken financial markets. Here's a look back at how AI moved the world in 2025. But first, as Bulgaria remains divided on the eve of joining the euro, we take a look at possible implications of switching to the single currency.

events.title: Countries around the worlds begin to welcome 2026, starting with New Zealand
events.description: New Zealand has opened the New Years ceremonies as always with an impressive display. Story by Ludovic de Foucaud and Emily Boyle.

events.title: China’s Xi hails nation's technological progress, renews Taiwan promise
events.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping has hailed his country’s technological progress in areas such as artificial intelligence and semiconductors

events.title: First Person: Felipe Paullier, the youngest ever senior UN official, charged with giving a voice to young people around the world
events.description: A paediatrician by training, Felipe Paullier has long been an advocate for youth. Formerly Director of the Uruguayan Government's Youth Institute, a role which involved several joint actions with various UN agencies, he was appointed to run the UN Youth Office in 2023, the youngest senior appointment in United Nations history.

events.title: ISIS exploiting Syria’s chaos as US strikes expose growing threat
events.description: Despite years of defeat claims, ISIS adapts and persists in Syria's chaos, prompting major U.S. military response and raising containment questions.

events.title: EU's top diplomat rejects Russian claims of Ukrainian attack on government sites
events.description: It comes as Russia releases video which it claims shows a downed Ukrainian drone launched at one of Putin's residences.

events.title: Bulgaria joins the euro after rocky path to new currency
events.description: The move is dividing the nation - some welcome it as a bold leap forwards, but others fear it will lead to economic stagnation.

events.title: Passenger describes 'chaos' after head-on Machu Picchu train collision
events.description: Tourist Niels Honkoop says shattered glass littered the carriage floor and injured people were lying in the aisles.

events.title: What is behind the Saudi-UAE rupture in Yemen?
events.description: United Arab Emirates says its troops are pulling out of Yemen after the attack by Saudi Arabia.

events.title: Trump Media company announces plans to award shareholders digital tokens
events.description: President Donald Trump, the majority shareholder for Trump Media, has actively championed the growth of cryptocurrency.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: Bangladesh mourns death of first female Prime Minister Khaleda Zia
events.description: Bangladesh is mourning the death of its first female Prime Minister, Khaleda Zia, who died Tuesday.

events.title: CIA behind strike at Venezuelan dock that Trump claims was used by drug smugglers, AP sources say
events.description: The CIA was behind a drone strike last week at a docking area believed to have been used by Venezuelan drug cartels. That's according to two people familiar with details of the operation.

events.title: Germany: Merz says 2026 can be a 'year of new beginnings'
events.description: Chancellor Friedrich Merz touched on war in Ukraine, increased defense spending, changing ties to the US, technological upheaval, industrial stagnation, sluggish reforms, migration and more in his New Year's address.

events.title: Eurostar back on track after Channel Tunnel power fault
events.description: The operator of the train service connecting Britain with continental Europe has warned that delays may persist as travelers head out in the run-up to the New Year.

events.title: 2025 The Year in Review
events.description: In tonight's edition, from the heartbreak and uncertainties of the war in Sudan to Africa's wrestling with White House unpredictability to the never-ending stories of creation, community, and innovation. We take a peek back at some of what 2025 delivered.

events.title: Ukraine: War medics confront their trauma in mountain retreat
events.description: Deep in the Carpathian mountains in west Ukraine, a government programme offers Ukrainian military medics a ten-day respite from the war while helping them confront their traumas. #ukraine #ukrainewar #ukrainearmy

events.title: Australia PM commends 'courage and compassion' after Bondi Beach attack in New Year's message
events.description: Anthony Albanese has commended the "courage and compassion" shown in Australia after the Bondi Beach attack in his New Year's message.

events.title: Search for Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 resumes
events.description: The deep-sea search for missing Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 has begun - more than a decade after the jet vanished with 239 people on board.

events.title: Leaders from Europe and Canada discuss US-led peace efforts as Russia-Ukraine tensions spike
events.description: Leaders from Europe and Canada have held talks on U.S.-led peace efforts to end the war between Russia and Ukraine

events.title: Latest deep-sea search for missing Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 gets underway
events.description: A deep-sea search for Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 has begun in the Indian Ocean, reviving efforts to solve one of aviation’s greatest mysteries

events.title: Queen Camilla recalls assault in 1960s as she campaigns against domestic violence
events.description: Britain’s Queen Camilla has spoken publicly for the first time about her personal experience of indecent assault

events.title: San Antonio teen who vanished Christmas Eve found dead by suicide in nearby field after days-long search
events.description: Authorities confirmed missing San Antonio teen Camila Mendoza Olmos, 19, who vanished Christmas Eve, died by suicide after her body was found near her house.

events.title: Ex-police officer given prison time in case prosecuted under Soros DA sees conviction overturned a year later
events.description: A court has overturned the conviction of a former Austin Police Officer Christopher Taylor, acquitting him of all charges in connection to a 2019 shooting.

events.title: Texas sheriff 'strongly' believes remains found belong to missing teen Camila Mendoza Olmos
events.description: Texas sheriff believes remains found in field belong to missing teen Camila Mendoza Olmos, who vanished from hone on Christmas Eve near San Antonio.

events.title: Body found during search for missing Texas teen as another girl disappears and more top headlines
events.description: Get all the stories you need-to-know from the most powerful name in news delivered first thing every morning to your inbox.

events.title: Putin vows victory in Ukraine in New Year’s address amid Trump-backed peace talks
events.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin's defiant New Year's message contrasts sharply with President Donald Trump's diplomatic push as Ukraine-Russia war approaches fourth year.

events.title: Putin residence drone attack dismissed as implausible as Ukraine accusations mount
events.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin's residence allegedly targeted by Ukrainian drones, but drone expert Cameron Chell says the claims lack credibility due to tactical impossibilities.

events.title: Zelenskyy denies Russian claim that Ukraine attacked Putin residence
events.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy calls alleged drone attack on Russian President Vladimir Putin's residence a "complete fabrication" as tensions escalate between Ukraine and Russia.

events.title: In India, youths are quiet as Gen Z protests rock South Asia
events.description: Gen Z protests have shaken Sri Lanka, Bangladesh and Nepal in recent years — but not India. Why? In a Delhi coffee-house chat with DW, young Indians debate power, politics and the future.

events.title: Iran: Students join economic protests, president seeks talks
events.description: Students demonstrated at several universities in Iran, semi-official media reported, after demonstrations by shopkeepers and bazaar merchants moved the president to announce plans for talks with protesters online.

events.title: Almost half of all Germans want a ban on fireworks
events.description: In Germany, it's only permitted to sell fireworks in the three days leading up to New Year's Eve. Some line up early to buy them, while others have safety concerns and want to see them banned altogether.

events.title: Trump says ‘removing’ National Guard from Chicago, Los Angeles and Portland
events.description: US president backs away from troop deployment to US cities amid legal setbacks, vows return when crime 'begins to soar'.

events.title: Bulgarians worry over rising prices as country adopts euro
events.description: Bulgaria is saying goodbye to the lev and officially adopting the euro, but some citizens worry about higher prices.

events.title: US jobless claims slow in last full week of 2025 amid weak labour market
events.description: November saw highest unemployment since 2021, largely attributed to federal worker reductions under Trump.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: Guinea’s junta chief elected president after opposition boycott
events.description: Mamady Doumbouya reneged on promise not to stand and hand west African country back to civilian rule The head of Guinea’s junta, Mamady Doumbouya, who had pledged not to run for office after seizing power four years ago, has been elected president after the country’s electoral commission said he had secured a sweeping majority of the vote. Doumbouya, 41, faced eight rivals for the presidency but the main opposition leaders were barred from running and had urged a boycott of the vote held over the weekend. Continue reading...

events.title: Ivory Coast top Group F as Knockouts await
events.description: The fixtures for the Round of 16 have been decided. Ivory Coast finished first of Group F after coming from behind to beat Gabon 3-2. South Africa have a tough match against a sturdy Cameroon side to come after the Indomitable Lions capitalised on an unfortunate own goal by Mozambique's Nené. Meanwhile Algeria followed in Nigeria's footsteps as the only two teams to have won all of their games in the group stage. The Fennecs will be up against DR Congo next.

events.title: Trump drops National Guard deployment plans in Los Angeles, Chicago and Portland
events.description: US President Donald Trump has stepped back from plans to deploy National Guard troops in several large, Democrat-led US cities, he announced on Wednesday. The decision underscores the legal and political limits he has faced in using the military to support his tough-on-crime agenda during his second term.

events.title: What's inside Mexico's Popocatépetl volcano? Scientists obtain first 3D images
events.description: Scientists from Mexico’s National Autonomous University have created the first three-dimensional image of the Popocatépetl volcano's interior

events.title: Mali and Burkina Faso impose retaliatory travel ban on US nationals
events.description: Mali and Burkina Faso have banned U.S. citizens from entering their countries

events.title: Authorities investigating damage to undersea telecom cable in Gulf of Finland
events.description: Authorities are investigating damage to an undersea telecommunications cable in the Gulf of Finland that occurred between the capitals of Finland and Estonia

events.title: Venezuela arrests more Americans as Trump ramps up pressure on Maduro: report
events.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio confirmed 10 Americans were freed from Venezuela in a July prisoner swap. President Donald Trump sent an envoy to Caracas.

events.title: George Clooney ditches Hollywood culture for France, gains citizenship with wife and twins
events.description: George Clooney and wife Amal become French citizens with their twins, trading Hollywood glamor for peaceful farm life in the French countryside together.

events.title: Thailand releases 18 Cambodian soldiers held since July
events.description: The release is part of a new ceasefire deal after weeks of deadly clashes along the Thai-Cambodia border.

events.title: Hezbollah weapons deadline: What’s next for Lebanon amid Israeli strikes?
events.description: End of 2025 marks deadline for first phase of disarming Hezbollah, but group says it will not give up its weapons.

events.title: Four reasons why Benjamin Netanyahu may not want a Gaza ceasefire to hold
events.description: After his trip to the US, Israel's prime minister returns home in an apparently strong position.

events.title: US struck ‘big facility’ in Venezuela, Trump claimed without offering details
events.description: Trump alleged that US forces hit ‘very hard’ in what would mark his team’s first land strike on Venezuela if confirmed Donald Trump has claimed that US forces struck a “big facility” in Venezuela last week – but the president did not specify what it was, or where, and the White House has not commented further. “We just knocked out – I don’t know if you read or you saw – they have a big plant, or a big facility, where the ships come from. Two nights ago, we knocked that out. So we hit them very hard,” Trump told Republican donor and New York supermarket owner John Catsimatidis on Friday. Continue reading...

events.title: Iranian-American journalist offers an inside look at the protests sweeping Iran
events.description: NPR's A Martinez speaks with Iranian-American author and journalist Hooman Majd about the current wave of protests facing Iran and what they mean for its future.

events.title: What we know about the Saudi-led air strikes on ships in Yemen
events.description: Open-source imagery and data confirm that the vessels targeted by the Saudi-led coalition air strike on Mukalla, Yemen, on December 30, originated from the United Arab Emirates. The ships were carrying Emirati military vehicles used by a separatist group.

events.title: Dead birds on Florida beaches have experts worried about avian flu
events.description: Dead birds along Florida's Space Coast spark fears of a possible avian flu outbreak. Samples were sent for testing as wildlife officials monitor the situation.

events.title: Florida firefighters allegedly waterboarded, whipped rookie over TikTok video as 4 face criminal charges
events.description: Four Florida firefighters face criminal charges after allegedly waterboarding and whipping a 19-year-old rookie firefighter. Nearly a dozen employees fired.

events.title: Bear remains under California home after weeks of failed removal attempts
events.description: Bear trap in Altadena accidentally catches wrong animal as 550-pound black bear continues living under California home despite month-long removal efforts.

events.title: Wild video shows speeding car going airborne, ejects driver into backyard pool
events.description: Surveillance footage captures car crashing through Nevada home's backyard, ejecting female driver into pool.

events.title: Huge crowds mourn Bangladesh's first female PM at state funeral
events.description: A sea of mourners have gathered in Dhaka to pay final respects to Khaleda Zia, who died on Tuesday aged 80.

events.title: Mali and Burkina Faso impose travel ban on US citizens in tit-for-tat move
events.description: The two states say they are taking reciprocal measures after the US announced full-entry restrictions on their citizens.

events.title: Will Mali, Niger, Burkina Faso bloc reshape the Sahel?
events.description: A recent summit of The Alliance of Sahel States has raised security and economic hopes for Mali, Burkina Faso and Niger.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: Turkish police detain 357 suspects in raids against the Islamic State group
events.description: Turkish police have conducted large-scale operations against the Islamic State group across Turkey, detaining 357 suspects

events.title: Results expected 5 January after landmark elections in Central African Republic
events.description: Voting proceeded largely as planned in the Central African Republic’s first-ever combined presidential, legislative, regional and municipal elections, and ballot counting is now complete, the UN peacekeeping mission (MINUSCA) said on Wednesday, with results expected to be announced on 5 January.

events.title: Development cooperation agreement marks new phase in UN-Iraq partnership
events.description: Better access to education, the protection of the environment and good governance are some of the areas in which the United Nations helps countries improve.

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Rosé used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: French lawmakers to debate social media ban for children under 15
events.description: French lawmakers are set to debate a ban on social media for children under the age of 15 – as well as a prohibition on the use of mobile phones in high schools – that could begin with the next school year in September 2026.

events.title: Two African nations ban American citizens in diplomatic tit-for-tat following Trump admin move
events.description: Two West African nations issue travel bans on American citizens in retaliatory diplomatic move, following expansion of Trump administration travel restrictions list.

events.title: Eurostar to resume services to and from London after 'major disruption' in Channel Tunnel forced cancellations
events.description: Eurostar suspends all London services due to major power supply issues in Channel Tunnel and failed LeShuttle train, forcing passengers to rebook journeys.

events.title: Heated Rivalry author says TV success led to help with her Parkinson's
events.description: Rachel Reid says the publicity from the hit TV adaptation led a Parkinson's specialist to get in touch.

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
events.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

events.title: Saudi Arabia bombs Yemen over shipment of weapons that arrived from UAE
events.description: Saudi Arabia says it bombed Yemen’s port city of Mukalla over a shipment of weapons for a separatist force that arrived from the United Arab Emirates

events.title: Pope asks that Rome welcome foreigners as he closes out 2025
events.description: Pope Leo XIV has closed out 2025 with a prayer that the city of Rome might be a welcoming place for foreigners and fragile people young and old

events.title: Condom tax and cheaper childcare: China's plan to boost birth rates
events.description: Chinese people pay a 13% sales tax on contraceptives from 1 January, while childcare services are exempt.

events.title: Finnish police seize ship suspected of sabotaging undersea cable
events.description: Police arrested 14 crew members on the ship sailing from St Petersburg, Russia, to the Israeli port of Haifa.

events.title: Jailed HK tycoon's 'teeth rotting and fingernails falling off', daughter tells BBC
events.description: The daughter of Jimmy Lai tells the BBC that her father's health is deteriorating in prison.

events.title: Eurostar services return to normal after major Channel Tunnel disruption
events.description: The high-speed rail firm urged passengers to check before they travel as last-minute delays and cancellations are still possible.

events.title: Tatiana Schlossberg, granddaughter of John F Kennedy, dies aged 35
events.description: She shared her cancer diagnosis in an essay last month, writing that she had less than a year to live.

events.title: Guinea junta chief wins presidential election by landslide
events.description: The victory, which gives the junta leader a seven-year mandate, was widely expected.

events.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro undergoes third medical procedure for hiccups
events.description: The former far-right leader's wife said he had more treatment because the hiccups "had not stopped' since the weekend.

events.title: US imposes more sanctions on tankers transporting Venezuelan oil
events.description: The sanctions come amid President Trump's pressure campaign that critics say is aimed at toppling Nicolas Maduro.

events.title: Ivory Coast fight back against Gabon to top AFCON group ahead of Cameroon
events.description: Ivorians to face Burkina Faso in last 16 while Cameroon meet South Africa and Mozambique play Nigeria.

events.title: Finland seizes ship sailing from Russia after suspected cable sabotage
events.description: New telecommunications cable damage discovered in Finland's exclusive economic zone.

events.title: Oxfam, Doctors Without Borders slam Israel’s Gaza ban
events.description: Humanitarian organisations Oxfam and Doctors Without Borders are slamming Israel’s decision to ban them from Gaza.

events.title: Sudan lose to Burkina Faso as Algeria win again at AFCON 2025
events.description: Burkina Faso ‌book second place in Group E at ‍the Africa ‍Cup of Nations with a 2-0 win over Sudan.

events.title: A marriage of three: Will Mali, Niger, Burkina Faso bloc reshape the Sahel?
events.description: Since withdrawing from ECOWAS, the post-coup countries have inaugurated a new bank, TV station and joint military force.

events.title: How is Trump’s Big Beautiful Bill changing US taxes and healthcare in 2026?
events.description: Big changes are coming in the new year as healthcare subsidies expire and requirements for food assistance take effect.

events.title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
events.description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

events.title: Analysis: Fox News is about to enter the true No Spin Zone
events.description: This is it.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship — and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.title: The most beautiful sections of China's Great Wall
events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news
events.description: No description available.

events.title: More than 3,000 migrants died trying to reach Spain in 2025
events.description: Tighter border controls caused arrivals to decline sharply but forced people on to more dangerous routes, activists say More than 3,000 people died trying to reach Spain by sea over the past year, a sharp fall from the previous 12 months. However, activists cautioned that the drop reflected tighter border controls that have forced migrants to take increasingly dangerous routes. Continue reading...

events.title: Jair Bolsonaro undergoes second procedure to treat persistent hiccups
events.description: Former Brazilian president underwent a phrenic nerve block while temporarily released from prison for surgery Jair Bolsonaro underwent a second “phrenic nerve block procedure” on Monday to treat persistent hiccups. The treatment went well and the former Brazilian president’s condition is stable, according to his medical team. Continue reading...

events.title: Xi Jinping vows to reunify China and Taiwan in New Year’s Eve speech
events.description: Reunification ‘is unstoppable’, says Chinese president, a day after the conclusion of intense military drills China’s president, Xi Jinping, has vowed to reunify China and Taiwan in his annual New Year’s Eve speech in Beijing. Speaking the day after the conclusion of intense Chinese military drills around Taiwan, Xi said: “The reunification of our motherland, a trend of the times, is unstoppable.” Continue reading...

events.title: China forecast to have sold one in every 10 new cars in UK in 2025
events.description: Carmakers such as MG, BYD and Chery are set to pass 200,000 mark in sales, analysis suggests, double 2024’s total Chinese brands are on course to account for one in every 10 new cars sold in Britain during 2025, a marked increase on last year as sales increase across Europe. Manufacturers led by MG, BYD, and Chery are on track to break the 200,000 mark in UK new car sales in 2025, meaning they are very likely to account for 10% of the market, according to Matthias Schmidt, an analyst tracking electric cars across Europe. Continue reading...

events.title: ​Two cubicles, 73 women, one long queue: Japan’s female MPs fight for more loos
events.description: PM Sanae Takaichi joins petition asking for better facilities for women to match improved representation Nearly 60 female lawmakers in Japan, including the prime minister, Sanae Takaichi, have submitted a petition calling for more toilets in the parliament building for women to match their improved representation. Japanese politics remains hugely male-dominated, although the number of women in the parliament rose at the last election – and Takaichi became the first female prime minister in October. This is reflected by there being only one lavatory containing two cubicles for the lower house’s 73 women to use near the Diet’s main plenary session hall in central Tokyo. Continue reading...

events.title: Australian beef industry ‘extremely disappointed’ after China hits imports with 55% tariff
events.description: Levy on beef exceeding quotas to begin immediately as Beijing seeks to protect domestic industry Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Australian beef producers said they were “extremely disappointed” after China announced a 55% tariff on imports that exceed quota levels in a move to protect a domestic cattle industry slowly emerging from oversupply. China’s commerce ministry said on Wednesday the total import quota for 2026 for Australia and other countries such as Brazil and the US covered under its new “safeguard measures” is 2.7m metric tons, roughly in line with the record 2.87m tons it imported overall in 2024. Continue reading...

events.title: Damien Martyn, former Australian Test cricketer, in induced coma with meningitis
events.description: The 54-year-old was admitted to hospital on Boxing Day Martyn played total of 67 Tests between 1992 and 2006 The former Australian Test cricketer Damien Martyn has been admitted to hospital and placed in an induced coma after being diagnosed with meningitis. The sporting community is rallying around the 54-year-old, who “is in for the fight of his life”, according to the former AFL player Brad Hardie, who revealed Martyn’s condition on 6PR on Tuesday. Continue reading...

events.title: Out with the mayo: How Ukrainians reclaim holiday food
events.description: For many people from former Soviet countries, New Year's is a big holiday feast time. A Ukrainian restaurant in Washington gives NPR a taste of what's on the menu.

events.title: Ukraine updates: Kyiv says it struck Russia's oil facilities
events.description: According to officials in Kyiv, Ukrainian long-range drones struck an oil depot north of Moscow, as well as an oil refinery and an oil terminal in Russia's southern Krasnodar region. Follow DW for more.

events.title: A German tip for your New Year's resolutions
events.description: Starting off the year with ambitious plans to become a better person is a widespread Western tradition. What are the most popular resolutions in Germany? And here's how the German language can help you deal with yours.

events.title: From education to marriage, major human rights gains of 2025
events.description: Though 2025 saw flagrant human rights abuses across the globe, the year also brought many positive developments.

events.title: Fact check: Content farm videos on Merz, Starmer and Trump
events.description: Fake videos of political leaders often go viral online. DW's Fact check department analyzes how content farms use algorithm-driven formats, and what narratives they reinforce.

events.title: Guinea's junta leader declared winner of presidential election
events.description: Mamadi Doumbouya secured almost 87% of the vote, while several opposition figures were either barred from contesting or were in exile. Doumbouya seized power after staging a coup in 2021.

events.title: Tatiana Schlossberg, granddaughter of JFK, dies aged 35
events.description: Tatiana Schlossberg revealed she had been diagnosed with a rare type of leukemia in an essay in The New Yorker last month. She was highly critical of her relative Robert F. Kennedy Jr., the US health secretary.

events.title: Algeria complete perfect group stage
events.description: The Fennecs are just one of two sides to have won all of their games so far at AFCON. Just as Nigeria did yesterday, they've finished top of their group by putting on a show of strength in their 3-1 victory over Equatorial Guinea, with three goals scored in the first half.

events.title: Ivory Coast challenged in 3-2 win against Gabon
events.description: The defending champions were surprised by the Panthers who pounced early on to take a 2-0 lead in the first 21 minutes. Krasso, Guessand and Touré helped the Elephants climb back and secure the top spot of their group, finishing ahead of Cameroon and setting up a Round of 16 game against Burkina Faso.

events.title: Winner predictions after AFCON group stage
events.description: The group stage of this year's Africa Cup of Nations has made for some exciting games. Halfway through the competition, what are France 24's consultants' predictions for the knockout round?

events.title: Minister criticises Clooney's fast-tracked French passport as 'double standard'
events.description: A junior minister on Wednesday said the French citizenship granted to Hollywood star George Clooney despite his poor level of French suggested a "double standard". The Clooney family became citizens just days before language requirements were toughened under new rules from January 1.

events.title: ‘Unity, strength, hope’: Macron calls for a fruitful 2026 in New Year’s address
events.description: French President Emmanuel Macron said in his New Year's address that 2026 "can be and must be a fruitful year" as he attempts to regain some momentum and launch the final projects of his second five-year term.

events.title: Finland seizes ship sailing from Russia after suspected undersea cable sabotage
events.description: Finnish authorities seized a vessel on Wednesday, suspected of sabotaging an undersea telecommunications cable in the Baltic Sea.

events.title: Finland police seize vessel suspected of damaging Baltic Sea cable
events.description: Finnish police have seized a cargo vessel suspected of damaging an undersea cable.

events.title: Passenger describes being stranded on Eurostar train overnight - as disruption continues
events.description: Passengers have been stuck on a Eurostar train for hours overnight, after the train network was forced to cancel large parts of its London-Europe service on Tuesday.

events.title: $40m worth of motorcycles seized in hunt for ex-Olympic snowboarder turned 'drug kingpin'
events.description: Mexican officials have seized dozens of motorcycles worth around $40m in the hunt for a former Olympic snowboarder who is on the FBI's Ten Most Wanted list.

events.title: Ex-Australia batter in induced coma after contracting meningitis
events.description: Ex-Australia batter Damien Martyn has been placed in an induced coma after contracting meningitis.

events.title: Israel suspends 37 aid organisations from operating in Gaza
events.description: Israel says it is suspending more than 30 humanitarian organisations, including Doctors Without Borders, from operating in Gaza for failing to comply with new registration rules.

events.title: Khaleda Zia, former Bangladeshi prime minister and archrival of a previous premier, dies at 80
events.description: Former Bangladeshi Prime Minister Khaleda Zia has died at 80, her political party has announced Tuesday

events.title: China announces it 'successfully completed' Taiwan military maneuvers
events.description: China’s People’s Liberation Army says it has “successfully completed” two days of military exercises in the waters off Taiwan

events.title: China flexes blockade capabilities near Taiwan on second day of military drills
events.description: China's People's Liberation Army is conducting large-scale military drills around Taiwan as part of "Justice Mission 2025."

events.title: Italy's Parliament approves 2026 budget with deficit-cutting measures
events.description: Italy’s Parliament has approved the government’s 2026 budget, which includes deficit-cutting measures

events.title: General Assembly approves $3.45 billion UN regular budget for 2026
events.description: The General Assembly has approved a $3.45 billion regular budget for the United Nations for 2026, following weeks of intensive negotiations and one of the Organization’s most important reform initiatives, UN80.

events.title: LIVE: General Assembly decides on 2026 UN budget
events.description: Follow our live coverage as the General Assembly and its Fifth Committee meet today to finalize negotiations and vote on the United Nations’ regular budget for 2026. The Fifth Committee is responsible for administrative and budgetary matters, including the Organization’s finances and staffing. UN News app users can click here and go here for all our in-depth meeting coverage.

events.title: Deported illegal immigrant caught by GPS tracker pleads guilty to robbing 7 convenience stores in California
events.description: Previously deported man from El Salvador pleads guilty to armed robberies across eight California cities, facing up to 20 years per count in prison.

events.title: Texas woman tries to flee to Mexico across Rio Grande with infant after human smuggling bust, authorities say
events.description: A Texas woman accused of human smuggling allegedly tried to flee across Rio Grande with infant after high-speed chase near the Mexico border.

events.title: 40-year Harvard professor pens scathing piece on school's 'exclusion of white males,' anti-Western trends
events.description: Harvard professor leaves after 40 years, alleges woke policies destroyed academic standards and excellence in scathing "Why I'm Leaving Harvard" critique.

events.title: Minnesota's new Medicaid fraud prevention fix won't make 'any difference,' former FBI agent says
events.description: Minnesota adds new Medicaid fraud verification after alleged $9B+ taxpayer losses since 2018, but former FBI agent says one layer won't stop fraud.

events.title: Zelenskyy claims Trump said US will consider giving Ukraine decades of security guarantees
events.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy indicated that American President Donald Trump said the U.S. will entertain the prospect of providing Ukraine with decades of security guarantees.
